item.title: Synthetic ambient noise and noise cross-correlations
item.description: 1. Background Ambient noise tomography has been a very popular imaging strategy of investigating the earth’s interior in past over two decades. The basic principle of this method is that stacked cross-correlations from noise recordings made by two receivers can be approximately the Green’s function from one receiver to another. We have the need of synthesizing ambient noise for validating this important idea, or exploring characteristics of ambient noise. Here we introduce a simple way of computing synthetic ambient noise.
